hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by a man from Bani Yarbu': I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while he was saying: 'The hand of the giver is the upper hand; your mother and your father, your sister and your brother'

Topics: Generosity and giving to family members
The superiority of the giver's hand

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated: Indeed, people from Thaalbah ibn Yarbu' came to the Prophet ﷺ and they came to him while he was saying: 'The hand of the man is the upper hand; your mother and your father, your sister and your brother, then those nearest, those nearest.' A man said to the Prophet ﷺ: 'These are the sons of Thaalbah ibn Yarbu', killers of so-and-so.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'No soul shall suffer for the deeds of another'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by a man from Bani Tamim named Thaalbah ibn Zahdham: Abu Mas'ud went out on the day of Eid al-Fitr or Eid al-Adha and he saw people praying before the prayer, so he called out with his voice saying: 'O people! There is no prayer on this day until the Imam prays'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Al-Aqra' ibn Habis: He called to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ from behind a screen, saying: 'O Muhammad, indeed my praise is adornment and my blame is disgrace.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'That is Allah the Most High'

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Jurayy al-Hujaymi, his name is Jabir ibn Sulaym

potential_issues.issue: Not a hadith transmission - biographical entry only
potential_issues.impact: This is a name introduction entry

Topics: Biographical notice about Abu Jurayy al-Hujaymi

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Jurayy al-Hujaymi: A man asked the Prophet ﷺ saying 'O Messenger of Allah, we are people from the desert, teach us something by which Allah may benefit us.' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Do not belittle any good deed, even if it be pouring water from your bucket into the vessel of your brother, and meet your brother with a cheerful face, and do not wear your garment dragging, for indeed dragging is from vanity and Allah does not love vanity. And if your brother curses you for what he knows in you, do not curse him for what you know in him'

hadiths.english_translation: I said: O Messenger of Allah, advise me. He said: 'Do not curse anyone, free or slave, a sheep or a camel'

hadiths.english_translation: I said: O Messenger of Allah, increase for me. He said: 'The wrap/garment should be to the middle of the shin, but if you refuse then to the ankles. And beware of vanity, for indeed Allah does not love vanity'

hadiths.english_translation: I said: O Messenger of Allah, increase for me. He said: 'If a man censures you for something he knows in you, do not censure him for something you know in him, so that the harm of that be upon him.' Abu Khalid said: I think he said: 'And the reward of that be for you'
